test_name: RBI Grade B - Phase 1 Mock Test #2

questions.question: Based on the financial soundness parameters for December 2024, which of the following statements correctly compares the performance of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) and Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs)?

options.A: The Capital to Risk Weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for SCBs was higher than that for NBFCs.
options.B: The Return on Assets (RoA) for SCBs was higher than that for NBFCs.
options.C: NBFCs had a lower Gross Non-Performing Asset (GNPA) ratio than SCBs.
options.D: NBFCs had a higher Gross Non-Performing Asset (GNPA) ratio than SCBs.
options.E: Both SCBs and NBFCs reported a Return on Assets (RoA) below 1%.

questions.explanation: As per the data in the footnotes, in December 2024, the GNPA ratio for NBFCs was 2.53%, while for SCBs it was 2.42%. Therefore, the GNPA ratio of NBFCs was higher than that of SCBs. The CRAR for NBFCs (26.22%) was higher than SCBs (16.43%), and the RoA for NBFCs (2.86%) was higher than SCBs (1.37%). (Page 11, footnotes 23 & 26)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The National Green Hydrogen Mission, with an outlay of ₹19,744 crore, sets a specific production target. What is the targeted annual production of green hydrogen and by which year is it to be achieved?
questions.explanation: The National Green Hydrogen Mission, launched by the government, aims to achieve a green hydrogen production capacity of 5 Million Metric Tonnes (MMT) per annum by the year 2030.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the risk assessment scenarios, what is the estimated impact on domestic inflation if international crude oil prices are 10 per cent above the baseline?

options.A: Inflation could be lower by 15 bps
options.B: Inflation could be higher by 15 bps
options.C: Inflation could be higher by 30 bps
options.D: Inflation could be lower by 30 bps
options.E: There would be no significant impact on inflation

questions.explanation: In the scenario assuming crude oil prices to be 10 per cent above the baseline, domestic inflation could be higher by 30 bps, while GDP growth could be weaker by around 15 bps. (Page 20)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the share of stressed assets, defined as 31-180 days past due (dpd), in the microfinance sector as of September 2024?
questions.explanation: The microfinance sector showed signs of stress, with the share of stressed assets (31-180 days past due) rising from 2.15 per cent in March 2024 to 4.30 per cent in September 2024. (Page 67)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Bank credit to NBFCs has grown significantly over the past two years. What was the compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of bank lending to NBFCs from June 2021 to June 2023?
questions.explanation: Bank lending to NBFCs increased at a CAGR of 26.3 per cent during the past two years (i.e., from June 2021 to June 2023), which was well above the overall bank credit growth of 14.8 per cent. (Page 67)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Household Net Financial Savings (HNFS) fell sharply in 2022-23 compared to the pandemic peak in 2020-21. What was the HNFS as a percentage of GDP for the year 2022-23?
questions.explanation: Household net financial savings (HNFS) fell sharply to 5.1 per cent of GDP in 2022-23 from 11.5 per cent in 2020-21. This was primarily driven by a rapid rise in financial liabilities. (Page 50)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Ways and Means Advances (WMA) limit fixed by the Reserve Bank of India for the Government of India for the second half of FY 2025-26?
questions.explanation: To manage temporary mismatches in Government payments and receipts, the Reserve Bank of India fixed the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit for H2 of FY 2025-26 at ₹50,000 crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the surplus amount transferred by the Reserve Bank to the Central Government for the year 2024-25, and what was its approximate year-on-year growth?
questions.explanation: The surplus payable to the Central Government for FY 2024-25 was ₹2,68,590.07 crore. This represented an increase of 27.37 per cent over the ₹2,10,873.99 crore transferred in the previous year. (Page 223, 249)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the Economic Survey 2023-24, what was the estimated real GDP growth rate for the financial year 2024 (FY24)?
questions.explanation: The preface of the Economic Survey 2023-24 states on page 8, 'In May, we learnt that the Indian economy is estimated to have grown 8.2% in real terms in FY24.'
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the surcharge rate on income tax for a co-operative society with a total income exceeding one crore rupees but not exceeding ten crore rupees?
questions.explanation: For every co-operative society, the surcharge on income tax is calculated at the rate of seven per cent if the total income exceeds one crore rupees but does not exceed ten crore rupees. (Page 13, 120)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Private Final Consumption Expenditure (PFCE) as a share of GDP reached its highest level since FY03 in FY25. What was this share?
questions.explanation: PFCE as a share of GDP (at current prices) is estimated to increase from 60.3 per cent in FY24 to 61.8 per cent in FY25, which is the highest share recorded since FY03. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: A new Section 194T has been proposed for TDS on payments to partners of firms. What is the rate of TDS on payments like salary, bonus, or interest to a partner?
questions.explanation: The newly inserted Section 194T(1) mandates that a firm responsible for paying any sum like salary, remuneration, commission, bonus, or interest to a partner shall deduct income-tax thereon at the rate of ten per cent. (Page 73, 201)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India launched the PM Vishwakarma scheme in November 2024 to support traditional artisans. What was the total financial allocation for this scheme?
questions.explanation: The PM Vishwakarma scheme, launched in November 2024, was introduced with a total allocation of ₹13,000 crore to provide support to traditional artisans and craftspeople.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the Household Consumption Expenditure Survey (HCES) 2022-23, by what percentage did the Monthly Per Capita Consumption Expenditure (MPCE) in rural areas increase in real terms over 2011-12?
questions.explanation: The HCES 2022-23 results showed that the Monthly Per Capita Consumption Expenditure (MPCE) in rural areas increased in real terms by 40 per cent over 2011-12. (page 220)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As of September 2023, what was the Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks?
questions.explanation: The report states that for Scheduled Commercial Banks, the Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) stood at 16.8 per cent in September 2023. (Page 19, 63)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Domestic headline consumer price index (CPI) inflation recorded a six-year low in May 2025. What was this inflation rate?
questions.explanation: The report states that domestic inflation has been steadily declining, with the headline consumer price index (CPI) inflation recording a six-year low of 2.8 per cent in May 2025. (Source: Page 27, Para 1.16)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the headline CPI inflation recorded in February 2025, which was noted as a seven-month low?
questions.explanation: Headline consumer price index (CPI) inflation eased to a seven-month low of 3.6 per cent in February 2025, driven by a sharp decline in vegetable prices inflation. (Page 11)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The commencement of operations for a unit in an International Financial Services Centre leasing an aircraft or ship has been extended to claim deductions under Section 80LA. What is the new deadline?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 80LA extends the date of commencement of operations for a unit leasing an aircraft or a ship from 31st March, 2025 to 31st March, 2030. (Page 43, 149)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Approximately how many transactions per month were processed through the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) as of May 2025?
questions.explanation: The document highlights the success of India's digital transformation, noting that the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) was processing about 18 billion transactions in a month. (Page 11)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The report highlights a difference in monetary policy transmission across bank groups. During the May 2022-January 2025 tightening cycle, the WALR on outstanding rupee loans for Public Sector Banks (PSBs) saw lower transmission compared to Private Sector Banks (PVBs) primarily due to:

options.A: PSBs having a higher proportion of EBLR-linked loans.
options.B: PSBs having a comparatively higher share of internal benchmark-based loans like MCLR.
options.C: PVBs being slower to adjust their deposit rates.
options.D: PSBs benefiting more from low-cost deposits.
options.E: Foreign banks having the lowest transmission rate.

questions.explanation: The transmission to WALR on outstanding rupee loans was lower for PSBs, reflecting a comparatively higher share of internal benchmark-based lending rates, viz., MCLR and others in their portfolios, which have longer reset periods. (Page 97)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Private Final Consumption Expenditure (PFCE) growth at constant prices is estimated to be a key driver of demand in FY25. What is the estimated growth rate for PFCE?
questions.explanation: From the angle of aggregate demand, private final consumption expenditure (PFCE) at constant prices is estimated to grow by 7.3 per cent, driven by a rebound in rural demand. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: On June 26, 2023, the RBI prescribed a new standardised approach for determining minimum capital requirements for which type of risk, aligning with revised Basel standards?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank prescribed the new standardised approach for determining the minimum capital requirements for operational risk in order to secure greater convergence with the revised Basel standards. This new approach replaces all previously prescribed methods. (Page 145, Para VI.28)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Monetary Policy Committee's (MPC) stance following its October 2024 meeting?
questions.explanation: In the October 2024 meeting, the MPC unanimously decided to change the stance from ‘withdrawal of accommodation’ to ‘neutral’ to provide flexibility in monitoring the economic outlook. (page 12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was India's real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth projected at for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: Real gross domestic product (GDP) for India is projected to grow at 6.6 per cent in 2024-25, supported by a revival in rural consumption and strong services exports. (Page 24)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Provisioning Coverage Ratio (PCR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) as of September 2024?
questions.explanation: The provisioning coverage ratio (PCR) of SCBs improved further to 77.0 per cent in September 2024, largely due to proactive provisioning by Public Sector Banks. (Page 80)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the unemployment rate in India during 2023-24, as noted in the recent economic review?
questions.explanation: According to the document, the unemployment rate in India improved to 3.2 per cent during 2023-24, a significant decrease from 6% in 2017-18. (Page 10)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The RBI announced regulatory measures on investments in Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs) on December 19, 2023, with clarifications issued on March 27, 2024. Which of the following clarifications is correct?

options.A: Downstream investments by AIFs include both equity shares and other instruments.
options.B: Provisioning by a Regulated Entity (RE) applies to the entire investment in the AIF scheme, not just the proportionate part.
options.C: Proposed deductions from capital due to AIF investments affect only Tier-1 capital.
options.D: Investments in AIFs through intermediaries such as fund of funds are beyond the scope of the circular.
options.E: REs are mandated to liquidate investments only if the AIF's downstream investment is in the form of debt.

questions.explanation: The clarification issued on March 27, 2024, advised that: (i) downstream investments exclude equity shares; (ii) provisioning applies on a proportionate basis; (iv) deductions affect both Tier-1 and Tier-2 capital; and (v) investments in AIFs through intermediaries like fund of funds are beyond the scope of the circular. (Page 144, para VI.26)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The PM-KISAN scheme provides income support to land-holding farmers. What is the total annual financial benefit provided to each eligible farmer family?
questions.explanation: Under the PM-KISAN scheme, an economic benefit of ₹6,000 per year is transferred in three equal four-monthly instalments into the bank accounts of farmers’ families. (Page 378)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Union Cabinet approved the 'Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana' in July 2025. What is the primary objective of this scheme?

options.A: To provide direct income support to all farmers
options.B: To double the export of agricultural products within six years
options.C: To enhance agricultural productivity and improve infrastructure in 100 selected districts
options.D: To promote only organic farming across the country
options.E: To waive all agricultural loans for small and marginal farmers

questions.explanation: Approved for six years starting 2025-26, the PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana aims to enhance agricultural productivity, promote crop diversification, augment post-harvest storage, and improve credit facilities in 100 selected districts.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What percentage of the ₹2000 banknotes in circulation on May 19, 2023, had been returned to the banking system by March 31, 2024?
questions.explanation: Of the ₹3.56 lakh crore of ₹2000 banknotes in circulation as on May 19, 2023, when the withdrawal was announced, 97.7 per cent had returned to the banking system up to March 31, 2024. (Page 181, para VIII.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The gross non-performing assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks declined to what level in June 2024?
questions.explanation: The asset quality of Scheduled Commercial Banks improved, with the overall gross non-performing assets (NPA) ratio declining to 2.7 per cent in June 2024 from 3.7 per cent a year ago.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the voting pattern of the MPC on the resolution to keep the policy repo rate unchanged in the October 2023, December 2023, and February 2024 meetings, respectively?
questions.explanation: The MPC unanimously decided to keep the repo rate at 6.50% in the October and December 2023 meetings. In the February 2024 meeting, the decision was made by a 5-1 majority. (Page 12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the percentage increase in the size of the Reserve Bank's balance sheet for the year ended March 31, 2024?
questions.explanation: The size of the balance sheet increased by ₹7,02,946.97 crore, which is an 11.08 per cent increase, from ₹63,44,756.24 crore as on March 31, 2023 to ₹70,47,703.21 crore as on March 31, 2024. (Page 243, para XII.3)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The RBI revised the definition of 'Bulk Deposits' for Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) in October 2023. What is the new threshold for a single Rupee term deposit to be classified as a 'Bulk Deposit' for RRBs?
questions.explanation: On October 26, 2023, the Reserve Bank enhanced the bulk deposit limit for RRBs. 'Bulk Deposit' for RRBs would now mean single Rupee term deposits of ₹ one crore and above, revised from the earlier limit of '₹15 lakh and above'. (Page 146, para VI.33; Annex I, page 279)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate set to by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) in its February 2025 meeting?
questions.explanation: In its February 2025 meeting, the MPC unanimously voted to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points from 6.50 per cent to 6.25 per cent. (page 12, 13)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme, how many railway stations have been identified for redevelopment to enhance passenger amenities?
questions.explanation: Under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme, which is aimed at enhancing railway station amenities, 1337 stations have been identified for redevelopment, with work having started in 1197 of them. (Page 212, Box VI.2)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Return on Equity (RoE) for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) remained strong, reaching a near decadal high in March 2024. What was this reported figure?
questions.explanation: In March 2024, the Return on Equity (RoE) for the banking sector was 13.8 per cent, bolstered by high net interest margins and strong credit demand. (Page 18, 58)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Capital to Risk-Weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks as of September 2024?
questions.explanation: At the end of September 2024, the Capital to Risk-Weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) of Scheduled Commercial Banks stood at 16.7 per cent, well above the regulatory norm. (Page 84, Para 2.10 & Chart II.3b)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: At the end of December 2024, the BSE market capitalisation to GDP ratio rose significantly. What was this ratio, indicating a high level of market valuation?
questions.explanation: The BSE market capitalisation to GDP ratio stood at 136 per cent at the end of December 2024, rising significantly over the last 10 years and indicating increased market capitalisation relative to the size of the economy. (Page 100)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: On June 11, 2024, RBI issued guidelines advising Scheduled Commercial Banks to maintain a uniform turnaround time (TAT) for loans up to ₹25 lakh for micro and small enterprise (MSE) borrowers. What is this uniform TAT?
questions.explanation: Scheduled commercial banks (SCBs) have been advised to have a uniform turnaround time (TAT) of 14 days for loans up to ₹25 lakh for micro and small enterprises (MSE) borrowers to ensure faster disposal of such loan applications. (Page 128, 278)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The share of gold in the Net Foreign Assets (NFA) of the Reserve Bank saw a significant increase, rising from 8.1 per cent at the end of October 2023 to what level as on January 10, 2025?
questions.explanation: On the sources side (assets), the share of gold in NFA increased from 8.1 per cent as at end-October 2023 to 11.2 per cent as on January 10, 2025, mainly due to revaluation gains. (Page 37)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected average CPI inflation for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: The projection of CPI inflation for 2024-25 was retained at 4.5 per cent by the MPC. This is also mentioned in the inflation outlook section. (Page 2, 17)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Considering the risk scenarios for the Indian economy, what would be the estimated impact on inflation and GDP growth if the INR appreciates by 5 per cent relative to the baseline?

options.A: Inflation moderates by 25 bps, GDP growth moderates by 35 bps
options.B: Inflation rises by 35 bps, GDP growth benefits by 25 bps
options.C: Inflation moderates by 35 bps, GDP growth moderates by 25 bps
options.D: Inflation rises by 25 bps, GDP growth moderates by 35 bps
options.E: Inflation moderates by 50 bps, GDP growth is unaffected

questions.explanation: In the scenario where the INR appreciates by 5 per cent relative to the baseline, it is estimated that inflation could moderate by around 35 bps and GDP growth could moderate by around 25 bps. (page 23)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Capital-to-Risk-Weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) stood well above the norm as of September 2024. What was this ratio?
questions.explanation: The capital-to-risk-weighted assets ratio (CRAR) for SCBs stands at 16.7 per cent as of September 2024, well above the regulatory norm, indicating robust capital buffers. (Page 74, 84)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In line with its commitments at COP29, India launched the National Green Hydrogen Mission. What is this mission's production target by 2030, and what was the total installed renewable energy capacity milestone India crossed by March 2025?
questions.explanation: The National Green Hydrogen Mission targets a production of 5 Million Metric Tonnes (MMT) by 2030. This initiative aligns with India's broader renewable energy goals, which saw the country's installed renewable capacity cross the 200 GW milestone by March 2025.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Following the regulatory increase in risk weights on certain consumer credit segments, what is the estimated decline in the banking system's CRAR and CET1 ratio, respectively, in basis points (bps)?
questions.explanation: The report estimates that after adjusting for the increase in risk weights, the CRAR of the banking system (PSBs + PVBs) would decline by 71 bps, and the CET1 ratio would fall by 58 bps. (Page 68)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the financial soundness indicators for banks in India at the end of June 2024, which of the following combinations of Gross NPA ratio, Net NPA ratio, and Capital Adequacy Ratio is correct?

options.A: Gross NPA: 2.5%, Net NPA: 0.6%, Capital Adequacy: 16.7%
options.B: Gross NPA: 2.7%, Net NPA: 0.6%, Capital Adequacy: 16.7%
options.C: Gross NPA: 2.7%, Net NPA: 0.8%, Capital Adequacy: 16.5%
options.D: Gross NPA: 2.9%, Net NPA: 0.7%, Capital Adequacy: 17.1%
options.E: Gross NPA: 2.5%, Net NPA: 0.5%, Capital Adequacy: 16.9%

questions.explanation: According to the bulletin, at the end of June 2024, Gross non-performing assets were 2.7 per cent of total assets, the net non-performing asset ratio was 0.6 per cent, and banks in India maintained a capital ratio of 16.7 per cent. (Source: Page 27)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For contravention of the 'track and trace mechanism' for certain goods under the newly inserted Section 148A of the CGST Act, what is the penalty prescribed under the new Section 122B?

options.A: Rs. 50,000 or 5% of the tax payable, whichever is higher
options.B: Rs. 1,00,000 or 10% of the tax payable, whichever is higher
options.C: Rs. 2,00,000 or 25% of the tax payable, whichever is higher

questions.explanation: The newly inserted section 122B of the CGST Act states that a person who contravenes the provisions of section 148A shall be liable to pay a penalty equal to an amount of one lakh rupees or ten per cent of the tax payable on such goods, whichever is higher. (Page 76)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the net Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) inflow recorded during the period of April-November 2024?
questions.explanation: Net FDI declined significantly to US$ 0.5 billion during April-November 2024, a sharp drop from the US$ 8.5 billion recorded in the same period a year ago. This was due to a rise in repatriation and net outward FDI. (Page 43)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the total financial allocation for the PM Vishwakarma scheme, launched in November 2024 for traditional artisans?
questions.explanation: The government launched the PM Vishwakarma scheme in November 2024 with a total allocation of ₹13,000 crore to support traditional artisans and craftspeople.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the analytical framework presented in Box I.1, what monetary policy action is warranted in a scenario of repeated food inflation shocks coupled with robust aggregate demand conditions?

options.A: A less aggressive monetary policy action due to the transitory nature of shocks.
options.B: No policy response, as monetary policy should look through food inflation.
options.C: A more aggressive monetary policy action to counter compounding effects on core inflation.
options.D: A neutral stance, waiting for supply-side measures to take effect.
options.E: An immediate reduction in the policy rate to support growth.

questions.explanation: Scenario 2 in Box I.1 illustrates that in the event of robust demand conditions, the spike in core inflation from repeated food shocks will be compounded, warranting more aggressive monetary policy action. (Page 22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) as recorded in September 2023?
questions.explanation: For scheduled commercial banks (SCBs), the capital to risk-weighted assets ratio (CRAR) stood at 16.8 per cent in September 2023. (Page 19, 63)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the guidelines on Default Loss Guarantee (DLG) in Digital Lending, what is the maximum percentage of the outstanding loan portfolio that a Lending Service Provider (LSP) can guarantee?
questions.explanation: The guidelines on DLG arrangements lay down several regulatory guardrails, including a limit on DLG to five per cent of the outstanding loan portfolio. (Page 143, Para VI.21)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the guidelines on Default Loss Guarantee (DLG) in digital lending, the DLG is limited to what percentage of the outstanding loan portfolio?
questions.explanation: The guidelines on DLG in digital lending lay down several regulatory guardrails, including limiting the DLG to five per cent of the outstanding loan portfolio. (Page 143, para VI.21)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the risk parameter disclosures for mutual funds for May 2024, what was the range of days required to liquidate 25% of the portfolio for the top 5 smallcap schemes, and what does this imply about their liquidity risk?

options.A: 4 to 13 days, indicating lower liquidity risk compared to midcap schemes.
options.B: 12 to 36 days, indicating higher liquidity risk compared to midcap schemes.
options.C: 4 to 13 days, indicating higher liquidity risk compared to midcap schemes.
options.D: 12 to 36 days, indicating lower liquidity risk compared to midcap schemes.
options.E: 10 to 20 days, indicating similar liquidity risk as midcap schemes.

questions.explanation: According to the disclosure for May 2024, the time taken to liquidate 25% of the portfolio for the top 5 smallcap schemes ranged from 12 to 36 days. This is longer than the 4 to 13 days required for midcap schemes, indicating higher liquidity risk for smallcap funds. (Page 52)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In the credit risk sensitivity analysis under a severe shock scenario (2 Standard Deviation shock on GNPA ratio), what is the number of banks projected to fail to meet the minimum regulatory CRAR and their corresponding share of total SCB assets?
questions.explanation: The bank-level stress tests under a severe shock scenario indicate that six banks, which collectively hold 11.2 per cent of the total assets of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs), may fail to maintain the regulatory minimum level of CRAR. (Page 87)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the RBI's projected headline CPI inflation for Q2 of 2024-25?
questions.explanation: CPI inflation is projected with quarterly figures of 4.9 per cent in Q1, 3.8 per cent in Q2, 4.6 per cent in Q3 and 4.5 per cent in Q4 for 2024-25. (Page 17)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The RBI issued a revised Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework for Urban Co-operative Banks (UCBs). From which date will this framework become effective?
questions.explanation: The revised Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework for UCBs, issued on July 26, 2024, will be effective from April 1, 2025. It is applicable to all UCBs in Tier 2, Tier 3, and Tier 4 categories. (Page 139, 288)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was India's real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate in 2024-25, according to the Second Advance Estimates?
questions.explanation: Real gross domestic product (GDP) growth moderated to 6.5 per cent in 2024-25, as per the Second Advance Estimates (SAE) of National Income. (Page 29, 43)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Considering India's recent export performance, which of the following statements is/are correct?
1. India holds approximately one-sixth of the global market share in petroleum products.
2. India ranks as the world's largest exporter of insecticides.
3. In the global semiconductor export market, India is ranked ninth.
questions.explanation: Statement 1 is correct as the document states, 'India currently holds 13 per cent or a sixth of the global market share in petroleum products'. Statement 2 is incorrect; India is the 'third largest exporter of insecticides', not the largest. Statement 3 is correct as India is ranked 'ninth in semiconductors'. Therefore, only statements 1 and 3 are correct. (Page 39)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Union Cabinet approved the Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana in July 2025 for a period of six years. How many districts will be covered under this scheme?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet approved the “Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana” on 16th July 2025, for a period of six years, beginning with 2025-26 to cover 100 districts, inspired by NITI Aayog’s Aspirational District Programme.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the baseline assumption for the price of the Indian basket of crude oil for H2:2024-25?
questions.explanation: As per Table I.2: Baseline Assumptions for Projections, the price for the Indian basket of crude oil is assumed at US$ 80 per barrel during H2:2024-25. (Page 13)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In a contagion analysis that incorporates the impact of macroeconomic shocks, how many banks were projected to see their Tier I capital ratio fall below the 7 per cent regulatory minimum under 'adverse scenario 1'?
questions.explanation: In a scenario combining macroeconomic shocks with contagion effects, it was found that the Tier I capital ratio would fall below 7 per cent for four banks in adverse scenario 1, resulting in marginal additional solvency losses to the system. (Page 125)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP) has a potential of ₹6 lakh crore over FY22-FY25. What were the total monetisation receipts recorded from FY22 to FY24 against the target of ₹4.3 lakh crore for that period?
questions.explanation: The National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP) listed assets with a potential of ₹6 lakh crore for monetisation over FY22–FY25. During the period FY22-FY24, receipts worth ₹3.9 lakh crore have been recorded against a target of ₹4.3 lakh crore. (page 66)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The PM Vishwakarma scheme, launched in November 2024 to support traditional artisans, was introduced with what initial financial allocation?
questions.explanation: The Government of India launched the PM Vishwakarma scheme in November 2024 with a total financial allocation of ₹13,000 crore to uplift traditional artisans and craftspeople.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the approximate value of India's mobile phone exports in the fiscal year 2023-24, reflecting the success of policies like the Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme?
questions.explanation: The document highlights that policy measures like the PLI are showing results, with mobile phone exports increasing from 1.6 billion USD in 2018-19 to 15.6 billion USD in 2023-24. (Page 10, Footnote 9)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The rate of tax deduction at source (TDS) on income by way of commission or brokerage under Section 194H has been reduced. What is the new effective rate from October 1, 2024?
questions.explanation: As per the amendment to section 194H, the words 'five per cent.' have been substituted with 'two per cent.', reducing the TDS rate on commission or brokerage. (Page 72)

questions.question: What is the highest surcharge rate applicable on the income-tax calculated on the non-dividend, non-capital gains portion of an individual's income, if their total income exceeds five crore rupees and they have not opted for the Section 115BAC regime?
questions.explanation: For an individual with total income exceeding five crore rupees, the surcharge on income-tax is levied at the rate of thirty-seven per cent. While a proviso caps the surcharge on dividend and certain capital gains income at 15%, the highest rate of 37% applies to the rest of the income. (Page 12, Page 83)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to Section 194LBC, what is the new uniform rate of tax to be deducted at source on income payable to a resident investor from a securitisation trust?
questions.explanation: Section 194LBC has been amended to provide a reduced uniform TDS rate of 10% on income in respect of investment in a securitisation trust, replacing the previous differential rates of 25% and 30%. (Page 57, 168)

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee in its meetings between October 2023 and February 2024?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent through H2:2023-24 to align inflation with the target while supporting growth. (Page 12)

questions.question: Under the revised SAARC Currency Swap Framework for 2024-27, what is the total corpus for the newly introduced INR swap window?
questions.explanation: Under the new SAARC currency swap framework 2024-27, an Indian Rupee (INR) swap window has been introduced with various concessions for swap support in INR with a total corpus of ₹250 billion. (Page 210, Box X.2)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) throughout the first half of FY 2024-25?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5 per cent through H1 (first half) of 2024-25 in its meetings held in April, June, and August 2024.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the analysis of distributional characteristics of household inflation expectations, which of the following measures were found to be significant with a negative sign, suggesting their utility in predicting one year ahead inflation?

options.E: Standard deviation, Interquartile range, and Skewness

questions.explanation: The model's estimates suggest that measures of dispersion like standard deviation and interquartile range, as well as skewness, are significant with a negative sign in predicting one year ahead inflation, whereas median and mean were found to be not significant. (Page 16, Table I.1.1)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the approximate retail inflation based on the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in FY24?
questions.explanation: After averaging 6.7 per cent in FY23, retail inflation declined to 5.4 per cent in FY24, the lowest level since the Covid-19 pandemic period. (Pages 73, 132)

questions.question: For the assessment year beginning on April 1, 2025, under the revised new tax regime, which income tax rate is applicable for the income slab from Rs. 7,00,001 to Rs. 10,00,000?
questions.explanation: According to the new table under section 115BAC for the assessment year 2025-26, the tax rate for the income slab from Rs. 7,00,001 to Rs. 10,00,000 is 10 per cent. (Page 52)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What real GDP growth has the Reserve Bank of India projected for the fiscal year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: In a speech on the Indian macroeconomic experience, it was stated that for the current year (2024-25), the Reserve Bank of India has projected real GDP growth of 7.2 per cent, with risks evenly balanced around this forecast. (Page 20)

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) following its meeting from December 4-6, 2024?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee, in its meeting held from December 4 to 6, 2024, decided by a 4 to 2 majority to keep the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent. (Page 7)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the majority vote in the August 2024 MPC meeting to keep the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5 per cent?
questions.explanation: The report states that in the August 2024 meeting, the MPC decided by a majority of 4-2 to keep the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5 per cent.
